entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here‚Äôs How I‚Äôm Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I‚Äôll study first, what comes next, and how I‚Äôll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it‚Äôs the foundation of most topics in this certification. I‚Äôm spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I‚Äôm following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-programming-model and doing small hands-on exercises along the way.

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I‚Äôll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I‚Äôll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I‚Äôll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I‚Äôll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here‚Äôs the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

  1. Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)
    • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
    • So start here.
  2. Develop Full‚ÄëStack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)
    • Once you know the platform, you learn the developer tooling (BAS = Business Application Studio) which is key for CAP and full-stack apps. 
    • So this is your next step.
  3. Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)
    • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 
  4. Build Side‚Äëby‚ÄëSide Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)
    • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.
  5. Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)
    • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 
  6. Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)
    • This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you‚Äôve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I‚Äôll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you‚Äôre also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

 

I‚Äôd love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.
What topics are you finding most challenging so far and how are you managing the learning.

entry.title: Certification Renewal Assessment for SAP Certified Associate - Project Manager - SAP Activate
entry.content:
Hello,

I have the following questions on the certification extension/ renewal for "SAP Certified Associate - Project Manager - SAP Activate":

  1. Will the certification validity be extended for 12 months from the assessment completion date, or from the original certification expiry date?
  2. How many questions are there on the assessment?
  3. What is the passing score for the assessment?

 

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Digital Certificate Not Received After Passing Exam
entry.content:
Hi there, 

I recently passed the certification exam C_THR81_2505 on Oct 24, 2025, but haven't received the digital certification badge yet. 

I have submitted a ticket regarding this issue (5000240799) and currently still waiting for a response. 

  • In My Learning -> My Certifications, there are no certifications listed, and the exam attempt number under subscriptions were not deducted either.
  • However, In the SAP Certification page, where exams are scheduled, I do see the exam attempt number deducted, the result of the exam saying "passed", and the status of the exam being "Approved by Auditor" 
  • I can confirm that I have the two emails set up correctly (with different domains (different after the @ mark)) for my account as well 

I have also been seeing other similar issues posted on the community recently:

  • Subject: Escalation Request ‚Äì Digital Badge and Certificate Not Received for Completed Course Dear 
  • Certificate / Digital Badge Not Received 

It would be greatly appreciated if this post can be seen by one of the moderators here and hopefully escalate the issue. üôè

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Learning Journey - SAP Fiori Administration
entry.content:

Could you please advise how he can gain access to the materials on the Learning Hub? 

Thank you in advance for your support.

Anna

I am eager to retake the exam; however, I am experiencing difficulty in doing so.

From my understanding, I should have three remaining attempts. Could you please confirm if this is correct and advise on how I can proceed with scheduling a retake?

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,

entry.title: How Much Preparation Is Needed for the C_ACT_2403 Exam?
entry.content:
Hey everyone,

I‚Äôm preparing for the C_ACT_2403 (SAP Activate Project Manager) certification, and honestly, I‚Äôm feeling a bit nervous about starting my preparation. I would really appreciate some advice or guidance from those who have taken this exam or worked with the SAP Activate Methodology.

Study Time:
For those who passed this exam, how long did you study and what kind of study plan worked best for you?

Background:
I have limited hands-on experience with SAP project management. Do you think studying the official SAP materials, learning journeys, and freely available resources is enough to build a good understanding?

Recommended Resources:
Which official or community-approved resources helped you the most‚Äîsuch as SAP Learning Journey, SAP Help Portal, or openSAP courses?

Exam Experience:
If you‚Äôve attempted the C_ACT_2403 exam, are there any general tips or areas of the methodology that you feel I should pay extra attention to?

I‚Äôd be grateful for any advice, guidance, or suggestions from the community.
Thank you so much!

entry.title: Unable to view my certifications
entry.content: I am a former SAP employee and I am unable to view my certifications. Ticket is open but no replies. I need to take the stay current exam which will expire soon.

entry.title: Unable to view Digital badge after completing SAP certification exam
entry.content:
I recently passed my SAP certification exam, C_ABAPD_2507 (Backend developer - ABAP Cloud), on 23 November 2025 with 78%, but I have not yet received my certificate or digital badge.

I have already submitted a ticket (5000254053), but there has been no response from the support team so far.

I am a bit worried because my friend, who passed on the same day as me, received their certificate within a few minutes after completing the exam.

Could anyone from the SAP community please advise what I should do now? Any contacts or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

I have also linked my account with secondary e-mail address and gone through below links
https://learning.sap.com/getting-certified
https://d.dam.sap.com/a/yPyxmB


Hi @Margit_Wagner, Can you please help me with this.

Best regards,
Mohit Zanwar

entry.title: Certification - When will the testing format for the certifications change?
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a couple of questions regarding SAP S/4HANA certifications

  1. Upcoming changes to test formats
    Do you know when in 2026 the testing format for the following Sourcing and Procurement certifications is planned to change from theoretica to practical?

    • C_S4CPR ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì Implementation Consultant ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

    • C_TS452 ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

  2. Retirement of C_TS414 and possible replacement
    I noticed that the certification C_TS414 ‚Äì SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Quality Management is going to be retired.

    • Is there a plan to introduce a similar certification for Quality Management?

    • Is there any existing or upcoming certification you would recommend as a replacement or successor to C_TS414?

Thank you in advance for any clarification you can provide.

Anna

SAP Enterprise Learning  SAP Learning Solution  SAP Learning Hub

entry.title: SAP Certification and BTP query
entry.content:
Hi Team,
I have below query, can someone clarify me.

I am working in different Technology in infrastructure administrator with 11.7 years of experience . but I learned SAP BASIS & HANA administration. I am intrested in learning BTP admin as well in future after I got my job in BASIS.

which SAP certification is suitabe for BASIS person and the certification is mandatory to get a job ?
does SAP Learning HUB license is mandatory for any SAP certification to learn from there ?

Is it possible to learn only the conversion activities of ECC to S/4 HANA from SAP portal ?


sorry if my similar queries are repeated/answered by someone/discussed previously.

Thanks, Nandha
